sprint-text: On the way to a healthier version of yourself, every step counts. Haven't started your evaluations yet? No problem, you're on the right track! Begin your wellness journey now by starting a sprint. Your commitment to understanding and improving your health is the first step towards positive change. Come on, let's get started!
recent-pressure: Your most recent measured blood pressure was
goal-pressure: Your goal is to get below
recent-weight: Your most recent measured weight was
about-weight: Measure your weight regularly to keep track of your health and progress. By noting your weight, you can track changes over time and adjust your health goals to achieve a balanced and sustainable lifestyle.
about-blood-pressure: High blood pressure is linked to cardiovascular diseases but can be improved with medication and healthy habits. In our app, we focus on a healthy diet, regular exercise, and limiting alcohol consumption to lower blood pressure. If your blood pressure remains high, we recommend contacting 112 for medical care.
about-new-habits: We have analyzed the information you provided in previous steps. Based on this, we have developed the following recommendations on areas of your life that you can work on changing.
select-your-goal: Check the goals you want to work towards.
info-text-eat-habit: We recommend working on healthier eating habits
info-text-physical-activity: We recommend trying to increase the level of physical activity
info-text-alcohol: We recommend reducing or taking a break from regular alcohol consumption
how-to-measure-blood-pressure: Sit with back support and feet on the floor. Place the blood pressure cuff and rest for five minutes. No nicotine or caffeine 30 minutes before measurement. Measure three times with one–two minute intervals. Cuff at heart level. Skip the first measurement, write down both the second and third measurements.
why-we-need-this-data: Why do we need this data?
why-we-need-this-data-text: By collecting your personal health data, we can create a tailored and effective health plan for you. This information enables accurate monitoring of your health and helps us recommend the most suitable and individualized sprints to achieve your health goals. Your data is crucial for creating a personal and successful health revolution for you.
how-waitapp-works-text: With WAITapp, we take you on 'sprints', where each sprint lasts for 10 days. During each sprint, we will give you daily tasks and measurements to encourage you to improve a goal of your choice. These help you improve your lifestyle and provide real-time feedback on your progress. With WAITapp, healthy choices become a part of your daily life!
start-sprint-when-you-are-ready: Start the sprint when you are ready. Your journey begins now!
HighPhysicalItemOne: Perform intense exercise twice a week
AlcoholItemTwo: Buy healthy alternatives to alcoholic beverages
no-active-sprint-yet: It looks like you are not in an active sprint yet.
how-to-measure-pulse-text: Sit or lie down comfortably and relax for at least five minutes before starting the measurement. Place two fingers (index and middle finger) lightly on the side of the wrist where the pulse is most noticeable. Count the number of heartbeats in 60 seconds to get your resting pulse. For a more accurate measurement, repeat this three times and calculate the average of the measurements.
how-to-measure-waist-text: Stand upright and exhale normally. Place the measuring tape around the waist, directly above the hip bone. Ensure that the measuring tape is horizontal and does not press into the skin too hard. Check that the measuring tape is parallel to the floor and that you are not holding your breath while measuring. Read the measurement and write it down carefully.
this-function-is-wip: This function is still in progress
what-is-a-sprint-text: A sprint is a 10-day period where you focus on achieving a specific goal, such as losing weight, reducing alcohol consumption, smoking less, or being more active. During this intensive period, you receive tools and support to reach your health goals.
page-does-not-work: This page does not work yet!
recent-waist: Your last measured waist measurement was
goal-waist: Your goal is to reach below
enter-name: Enter your first and last name
invalid-dob-error: Date of birth cannot be in the future
invalid-ablation-error: Ablation date cannot be in the past
click-here-to-see-results: Click here to see your results
why-rapa: Used to help us assess your level of physical activity.
complete-these-for-more-accurate-experie: The more forms you fill out, the better your experience will be.
find-out-your-rapa: Find out your Rapid Assessment of Physical Activity by filling out a form
what-are-physical-activities: Physical Activities are activities where you move and increase your heart rate above its resting rate, whether you do them for pleasure, work, or transportation.
questions-about-rapa: The following questions ask about the amount and intensity of physical activity you usually do. The intensity of the activity is related to the amount of energy you use to do these activities.
phyiscal-activities-intensity-levels-exa: Examples of physical activity intensity levels
light-activity-description1: your heart beats slightly faster than normal
moderate-activity-description1: your heart beats faster than normal
moderate-activity-description2: you can talk but not sing
vigorous-activity-description1: your heart rate increases a lot
vigorous-activity-description2: you can’t talk or your talking is broken up by large breaths
rapa1_question1: I rarely or never do any physical activities.
rapa1_question2: I do some light or moderate physical activities, but not every week.
rapa1_question3: I do some light physical activity every week.
rapa1_question4: I do moderate physical activities every week, but less than 30 minutes a day or 5 days a week
rapa1_question5: I do vigorous physical activities every week, but less than 20 minutes a day or 3 days a week.
rapa1_question6: I do 30 minutes or more a day of moderate physical activities, 5 or more days a week
rapa1_question7: I do 20 minutes or more a day of vigorous physical activities, 3 or more days a week.
rapa2_question1: I do activities to increase muscle strength, such as lifting weights or calisthenics, once a week or more.
rapa2_question2: I do activities to improve flexibility, such as stretching or yoga, once a week or more.
missed-questions-error: Please answer all questions before submitting.
sprint-recap: you lost 7kg and improved your heart rate (placeholder)
